physical_appearance: This is a book. It has a black cover, with two decorative gold lines going horizontally across near the top and bottom of the book. In the center, there is a title printed in capital letters and in gold. The spine on the side has some gold stitching.
sgcool_label_text: This is a memoir of Henry Vacher, who departed from Southampton to work for the Peninsula & Oriental (P&O) shipping company in Calcutta in 1866. Privately printed and compiled by his son Francis, this memoir charts Vacher's life in India and Malaya, including a vacation he took to Singapore in 1873.
title_text: Twelve Years in India and Malaya: A Memoir of Henry Vacher
subject_terms_2: Autobiography Books Singapore India Colonies History
